explanation: Uses netcat in zero-I/O mode to rapidly attempt TCP connects (knocks) to a sequence of ports, a common method to activate knockd rules. Detection: alert on sequential connection attempts to closed ports from a single source within seconds.
rationale_steps: Iterate over the port list and send short-lived TCP connection attempts.
Remote knockd correlates the sequence and opens a hidden port for the source IP.
Operator proceeds to connect to the unlocked service.
Defenders monitor firewall/IDS logs for ordered port hits and subsequent allow rules for the same source.
